values:
Had a lovely day at 100 min war. Last minute decision. Didn't spend much time outdoors (brrrr).
Was great to get out and socialize for a change. My first event since Pennsic.
Great to see some of you there :)

Very plentiful and impressive day board.

So.

My plans to start a biz in CA are on the rocks, due in part to the economy, and in part to the reality of 'regulations', and the related expenses.  Not dead yet. But on the rocks.

I've finally been catching up on whay ya'll have been posting here. Been missing you all. Sorry I'm such an absentee friend, but you are always on my mind.

I've been so focused on making these dreams happen, that I've forgotten about the sweet reality around me.

Anyway, I'm glad to call you all friends.

Naz

Well, I know I'm a stranger here lately... but I haven't fogotten the place entirely.

Last weekend I made an anvil stand and this weekend I'm working on a bellows and on a Belgian Ale recipe. (And finally getting my Harley to the shop for that inspection).

Hope to see you all soon.

Pennsic is coming!
Naz

These guys kick ass!
You've gotta see them!
Saw them at the Sellersville Theatre tonight.
See them!

http://www.cgtrio.com/

7 F this morning! -10 with wind chill
wasn't it 69 F just about 5 days ago ?

Wow. Just got done watching (for the second time), Led Zep's "The Song Remains the Same" on DVD.
Ok, I may be old-school but this stuff just is timeless to me.
Energizes me.

Now, what to do with that energy at 9 on a Friday night with no plans....

I have been the complete sloth today ! And I LIKE IT. 
Just took the whole day off. Re-read "The Alchemist",  read some of "Sacred and Herbal Healing Beers", made myself an easy Italian dinner. Had a nice glass of wine. Now topping it off with a Cask Strength Macallan, whilst watching the PA channel's horse pull competitions (??!??!)

Oh, also completed registration for http://www.pantheacon.com/08/index.php.

Felt good to take a day off.

Well, not much new here. Hope everyone who's going has a great time at Yule, if you're going. I would have if I weren't up to my arse in alligators.

Hope everyone has a meaningful Yule. Security. And peace.
Actually managed to order Heather last night. Now to formulate a recipe from the several I'm looking at.

Well its been a long time since I posted here. 
Have been "out of touch" with everything and everyone since Pennsic. Including "myself".
Its not a good feeling.  Why do I let my job consume me ?

Been thinking I've got to get to Greenlane. Want to commit to actually helping, and maybe camping,  but just feeling rather overwhelmed lately. 
 
Been missing everyone. 

Have plans for a Heather Beer. So far no action.

Well, Maria and Nathan returned from their honeymoon and Pennsic 36 is history.
While I was at Pennsic, I became a grandfather.
Theresa gave birth to Scarlet, a brown haired, brown eyed, 6 lb, 5oz little beauty, the day after my birthday.
It's been a good summer.

I received a wonderful little book called Sacred and Herbal Healing Beers, for my birthday.
A wealth of information.

I had a good War. Wet, but good. It centers me, to be around such deep energy.
Debra totally enjoyed it (except for the mud).

Happy 694th, Aradia.

wow.. the wedding is nearly upon us...

Last weekend the third batch of wedding mead did NOT get bottled. After a few hours in the warmer temps, it decided to keep on bubbling.
Decisions decisions.. do I squelch the fermentation with chemicals or let 'er bubble for a week in these high temps... I decided to let 'er bubble.
Doubt it will be done by the end of the week. 

It's been going for 5+ months. Should be done. 
Going to bottle this weekend anyway. Without chemicals. *keeping my fingers crossed*

Well Pennsic prep has not really begun yet. Guess I should drag out the checklist and start pulling out the basic gear. In the next couple of weeks I am going to be just a LITTLE nutz. Looks like the Sin Pit finally got "back" to E5. My first time. Should be interesting. 

Well hel.  At least the daughter wants the bridal party (and the father of the bride) to be casual (and barefoot!).  What a "hippie" .. LOL. 
Wonder who she takes after.  Hope we can get the labyrinth built in time!

Well I wanted to bottle the straight mead today, but it decided to ferment a little more once it got to kitchen temp.
So... It will get to play another week or so before going into the bottle.

Anyway, looks like the kid's wedding plans are almost set.
And I'm actually finding time to think about Pennsic plans.

Even got to think a little about some smithing today.

Theresa's baby shower is today.  Couldn't bring myself to go to the ex's house. Or maybe its the grampa thing that keeps me away.
Theresa will have to pick up her pressie here.  Maybe Maria will come over before she heads back home.

Anyway, can't wait for the b-day celebration with
rarejul
.  Leo's can be so... testy ;)

I am SO appreciative of a day off. So I can BREW! (again)
Tomorrow I start the Honey Nut Brown Ale.

Which reminds me. There was a great "history of beer" episode of "Modern Marvels" on the History Channel tonight.
Recommend all brewers see it.

Well, I've finally bottled it.  It's kindof intense. Very fruity. Very alcoholic. Somewhat tart. Semi-sweet-to-dry.
Just the way I like it.

Good thing I went for the mid-level fruitiness. This stuff is INTENSE.

Me thinks it will be popular, nonetheless.

Tomorrow, the next batch of Orange-Ginger Mead. 

What a BEAUTIFUL day!

1. How and when did first find out about the SCA?
A lovely mysterious lady who I met at one of my favorite blues joints told me of her involvement in this intriguing Society.

2. What made you wanna come play?
Said mysterious lady. Her name is Cat.

3. Did you ever take sewing/cooking/archery/(other things that are found within the SCA) classes in school?
I shot archery but not period. I took metal shop in middle school. Far from period.

4. Why do you play now?
The lovely diverse people. The inspiring depth of curiousity and research. The enormous energy expended in the cause. The beautiful arts and sciences. The creativity. The ENERGY. THE DREAM.

5. Do you make your own garb?
Some. Not all. Wish I had more time.

6. Do you fight (heavy/rapier)?
No. Not yet.

7. Have you ever bartered with anyone?
Of course. Minor stuff. Expect to do a lot more in the near future. I'm thinking about a mead and/or iron work for garb and/or massage transaction.

8. What was your first event?
Landsknect. Thanks Cat, Tommy, Joe.

9. Describe your first garb.
Beige English 12 th C tunic.

10. Do any of the friends you had before the SCA now play also?
Not yet. Trying to recruit.

11. What were some of your favorite books/stories as a kid?
All over the map. Everything from Moby Dick to Treasure Island to the History of Weapons to The Fantastic Four (always wanted to be Johnny. He could fly.)

12. Have you registered a name?
Nazarius Orlandi

13. Have you registered Arms?
Yes. Per bend gules and vert, a dragonfly and hammer argent.

14. What is you favorite "No Sh*t, there I was" story?
Hmmm, well it could be Hell party umbrella party and pickle story, or maybe the one involving rope and a bamboo pole, or the one involving a green fairie. But let's leave it a mystery.

15. What A&S stuff are/could you be interested in?
Blacksmithing! Brewing! Currently doing both. Would like to do some bronze casting.

1. Who was your best friend?
Kurt and/or Karen

2.What sports did you play?
track (sprints)

3. What kind of car did you drive?
chevy impala

4. It's Friday night, where were you?
depends, most likely with Karen or playing in one of the many bands i was involved with

5. Were you a party animal?
sometimes yes, sometimes no

6. Were you considered a flirt?
no... i was way too conservative then... 

7. Were you in band, orchestra, or choir?
which one? ... the answer is probably yes

8. Were you a nerd?
depends on who i was hanging with at the time...

9. Did you get suspended/expelled?
nope.. i'm sneakier than that

10. Can you sing the fight song?
i avoid fights whenever possible

11. Who was your favorite teacher?
Rocco, the science guy 

13. School mascot?
Mountaineers

14. Did you go to Prom?
yep

15. If you could go back and do it over, would you?
nope, never in a million years

16. What do you remember most about graduation?
ummmm... getting ready to move to college (never looking back)

17. Where were you on senior skip day?
hmmmm... probably at third base hanging out

18. Did you have a job your senior year?
Yea, I was a car detailer and a concrete laborer.

19. Where did you go most often for lunch?
just out

20. Have you gained weight since then?
Gained and lost and gained.. but overall only up 15.. not bad for all those years. I was too thin then anyway.

21. What did you do after graduation?
Penn State Engineering school

22. When did you graduate?
High School? a very very long time ago... the US bicentennial

23. Who was your Senior prom date?
Karen - she's a veteranarian now. And I didn't even know she liked animals.

24. Are you going / did you go to your 10 year reunion?
Went. Who were all those old people?

25. Who was your home room teacher?
Isn't that wierd. I can't remember any of their names. Never had them for real classes.

Racked the IPA to secondary yesterday. Most excellent flavor. Around 5.25 %. Gorgeous amber. But cloudy. Forgot the Iriss Moss.
Ah well.  Maybe it'll clear.  Next week; bottling that Black Currant Melomel.

Going to visit with my Dad today.  

Wonder how Landsknect is shaping up.  One of my favorite events.  Wish I could have made it.

Had a great brew party yesterday. Thanks Kyle and
rarejul
 for hanging and helping out.
Was great to have Magnus (Tim) here to help too.

The first all-grain was ... erm... interesting. Thought I was going for broke with the equipment,
to help gaurantee success. But I ended up with a stuck mash. After some creative wort salvage by Vinny and I we got
the IPA off to a good start. It's fermenting up a storm and there is a strong hoppy breeze emanating.

For those who follow such things, I did a variant of the Brewmistress recipe from Homebrewing for Dummies.

Most of my group from work showed up, which was cool. Had great weather and left a huge mess. Musta been good.

Nearly all cleaned up today. Next. Honey Nut Brown.

Has anyone noticed that airline tickets for the summer have more than doubled in three months?

Has anyone noticed that Antarctica is melting?

Has anyone noticed I can't even keep my house in order?

Hope someone else can save Antarctica!

Dang!
My allergies are acting up... 

Good thing beer helps.

Well, today was my first day back at the office since returning from California.
I'm still desperately clinging to the ecstatic afterglow of a beautiful 5 days at Harbin Hot Springs (http://www.harbin.org/).
Steamy mineral hot springs, gorgeous forested campsites with abundant wildlife, plenty of free-spirits with whom to comingle.
Body work, ecclectic music... just WOW.
If you can, you MUST treat yourself.

Anyway, now turning my attention to the wedding and Pennsic prep.
Meanwhile, on the more fatalistic side of life... and just when I was getting good at mead making
http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/gate/archive/2007/05/09/notes050907.DTL
And tomorrow, I must catch up on that interface design I should have had done last week.

So I'm in that pre-vacation-time cruch to do all the work I would have done if I wasn't going.
But tomorrow afternoon, it won't matter! Because I'll be headed for some fun and relaxation.

Wooo Hooo! Lotta good blacksmithing stuff  for auction posted on the H-D list today.
I have my eye on so MANY things... wish I could be there the whole time... must look into proxy bids... must...
Have to work today. Won't be making it to either event...

Wow! Wish I could watch W eat his words!

http://www.cnn.com/2007/US/04/23/wiccan.grave.ap/index.html

Anywho... it was a good day today. Made some progress on all fronts.
Spring is finally here, and its past-time to get out the Harley !

It was great to see "everyone" at Emmaus Fair today. My first event since Metal Smiths last October.

violet_amy
 great chatting with you. Amazing how you pick up that Viking weaving thingie.  What did you call it? I can never remember that stuff. Hope I didn't distract you too much with my chatter.

Great seeing Asa and Wistan. Don't think I've seen them since Pennsic! Got some good advice  from Asa on belt grinders for my knife making. Speaking of which, I was thowing my knife-like-thing today and it was great. Now I just need to become a better thrower.

Found out that Colin does some blacksmithing too. He wants to talk with me about forge-welding. Which I will begin in ernest very soon. All that sizzling and sparking. Exciting!  Want to start my first pattern-weld billet in a few weeks. Need to wait on some "special" steel.

Amy, I hope you get Gavan to join here.

joef_johnm
 and
colmunson
 don't forget to post when you'll be sampling that sake! ;)
John, thanks for the sample of the Gruit. Looking forward to getting the recipe *hint* *hint*.
kandy_elizabet
, a pleasure to see you there.

Had fun watching Don cast brass axe heads. Yet another thing I now want to try. Just what I need. Actually he just "upscaled" my previous curiosity for casting, which had already been whetted by several people.

Very nice day, abeit a bit chilly on the throwing range. Now, I have to decide will it be Spring Thynge or Southern Region War Practice in two weeks. Decisions decisions. Any recommendations?

Well, I got a few hours in at the forge today. The knife is now finished shaping and annealing.
Began the manual "grinding" process this evening after two cycles of heat/slow-cooling, per Master Atar's approach.
Now some elbow grease and heat treating, and its on to the sheath.

Too bad the others couldn't make it. Hope to have an "open forge" again in about a month. By then, maybe I'll even have some extra stock and a vise to do some twisting.
violet_amy
, thanks for the call about the guild meeting. I wouldn't have noticed the posting, as I was at the forge. Hope you're back is doing ok.

Turned out to be a "never-mind" day all-around.

Damn. Anyone notice how cold it was out there today? Nice n toasty at the forge tho' :)

Whew! Just got back from the parent's house for the holiday... it was crazy... the usual.. too crowded, too loud, too much food... too much. Good to see everyone tho'.

Feeling drained. This cold isn't helping.

Didn't get to the event on Saturday. Had to get all the chores done before the trip. And had to make a cake for my sister, who graduated last week. Yay sis.

On other topics... 
Saw Grindhouse on Friday night. A real disappointment from Tarantino. Yet, glad I saw it.

I see Lou called while I was gone. Debra too. Will have to give them a call.

Well, better get some rest. Might be a bit windy for forging tomorrow. We'll see how it goes.

Well, the project at work is smoothing out. Got a synergy going. What a great technical team. Wish the rest were as good.

Want to get out and throw some weapons this weekend. With the trip to the parent's on Sunday, that may be a trick to pull off.

Plan to do some forging again this coming Monday, maybe a few friends will join me. Should be able to finish the forging on the rail spike knife and do some annealing prior to the grinding. Planning to use Master Atar's formula for hardening/tempering such a beast. Man, I can't wait to throw it on an SCA field.

Gearing up for another visit out west. This time will be checking out: http://www.harbin.org/

Wow. Time just keeps on movin...
I have GOT to rack that mead this weekend!

And oh yea... finally got that fabric... this oughta be a learning experience... now what do I do with these dyes...

Wow. What a beautiful day! Had the forge fired up and worked on two projects.

Mmmm, by the way... 
This Weyerbacher Hefewiesen goes great with grilled pork chops...

Ok, well now that most of the ice has melted outside, I'm ready to gear up for some major blacksmithing.
Collecting more goodies and hoping to have a get together within a few weeks for those who want to play.

Maybe by then I'll have a start on those bellows.

Also, collecting goodies for all-grain brew party. Wondering what it would be like to mingle the office crew with the SCA brewers at my place.

what's that saying ? 
how can you soar with eagles when you work with turkeys?
its days like this that make me appreciate a glass of melomel so well
cheers!

well... as if i have alot of time for garb-making...
just received notice that my shipment from dharma trading company is on its way...
some good forge-garb in the planning
